	at java.util.ArrayList.RangeCheck(ArrayList.java:539)
	at java.util.ArrayList.remove(ArrayList.java:424)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.AbstractDebugEventHandler$EventProcessingJo
b.runInUIThread(AbstractDebugEventHandler.java:96)
	at org.eclipse.ui.progress.UIJob$1.run(UIJob.java:96)

(EclipseStarter.java:333)

(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:58)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:391)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:268)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:260)

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:871)

Fixed in AbstractDebugEventHandler. We were using two locks - one for the 
event queue and one for the data queue. Instead, one lock should be used when 
adding/removing from the queues as they are supposed to be the same size, and 
data is processed with its corresponding events.

Modified locking to use a single lock when adding/removing events & data.
